intro: Krynitzkia affinis, commonly known as the Cape goldfish, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high sunlight exposure. Krynitzkia affinis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
